data.quote: The bird of paradise alights only upon the hand that does not grasp.
data.author: John Berry

data.quote: Life is made up of desires that seem big and vital one minute  and little and absurd the next. I guess we get what's best for us in the end.
data.author: Alice Caldwell Rice

data.quote: As the soft yield of water cleaves obstinate stone  So to yield with life solves the insolvable: To yield  I have learned  is to come back again.
data.author: Lao-Tzu

data.quote: As your faith is strengthened  you will find that there is no longer the need to have a sense of control  that things will flow as they will  and that you will flow with them  to your great delight and benefit.
data.author: Emmanuel

data.quote: For peace of mind  resign as general manager of the universe.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Eventually I lost interest in trying to control my life  to make things happen in a way that I thought I wanted them to be. I began to practice surrendering to the universe and finding out what "it" wanted me to do.
data.author: Shakti Gawain

data.quote: It had been my repeated experience that when you said to life calmly and firmly (but very firmly!)  "I trust you  do what you must " life had an uncanny way of responding to your need.
data.author: Olga Ilyin

data.quote: Men never cling to their dreams with such tenacity as at the moment when they are losing faith in them  and know it  but do not dare yet to confess it to themselves.
data.author: William Graham Sumner

data.quote: So often we try to alter circumstances to suit ourselves  instead of letting them alter us.
data.author: Mother Maribel

data.quote: Willfulness must give way to willingness and surrender. Mastery must yield to mystery.
data.author: Gerald G. May

data.quote: The worst thing you can do is to try to cling to something that's gone  or to recreate it.
data.author: Johnette Napolitano

data.quote: I claim not to have controlled events  but confess plainly that events have controlled me.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Letting people be okay without us is how we get to be okay without them.
data.author: Merrit Malloy

data.quote: We are the wire  God is the current. Our only power is to let the current pass through us.
data.author: Carlo Carretto

data.quote: There are two kinds of people: those who say to God  "Thy will be done " and those to whom God says  "All right  then  have it your way."
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Here am I  send me.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: 'Tis God gives skill  but not without men's hands: he could not make Antonio Stradivarius violins without Antonio.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: I am like a little pencil in God's hand. He does the writing. The pencil has nothing to do with it.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: Life is God's novel. Let him write it.
data.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

data.quote: I see not a step before me as I tread on another year  But I've left the Past in God's keeping  the Future His mercy shall clear  And what looks dark in the distance may brighten as I draw near.
data.author: Mary Gardiner Brainard

data.quote: To character and success  two things  contradictory as they may seem  must go together-humble dependence and manly independence: humble dependence on God  and manly reliance on self.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: Whate'er we leave to God  God does and blesses us.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: God will help you if you try  and you can if you think you can.
data.author: Anna Delaney Peale

data.quote: Doing what is right isn't the problem  it's knowing what is right.
data.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

data.quote: Let each look to himself and see what God wants of him and attend to this  leaving all else alone.
data.author: Henry Suso

data.quote: If you can't help it  don't think about it.
data.author: Carmel Myers

data.quote: God tests His real friends more severely than the lukewarm ones.
data.author: Katheryn Hulme

data.quote: In vain our labours are  whatsoe'er they be  unless God gives the Benediction.
data.author: Robert Herrick

data.quote: Much that I sought  I could not find  much that I found  I could not bind  much that I bound  I could not free  much that I freed  returned to me.
data.author: Lee Wilson Dodd

data.quote: Wanna fly  you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.
data.author: Toni Morrison

data.quote: The soul will take that love and put it where it can best be used.
data.author: Emmanuel

data.quote: God alone can finish.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Be God or let God.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: With us is the Lord our God  to help us and to fight our battles.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: It is better to trust in the Lord than to put confidence in man.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Cast thy burden on the Lord  and he shall sustain thee.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: But I trusted in thee  O Lord  I said  Thou art my God. My times are in thy hand.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: God's will is not an itinerary  but an attitude.
data.author: Andrew Dhuse

data.quote: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart  and lean not unto thine own understanding  in all thy ways acknowledge Him  and He shall direct thy paths.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Casting all your care upon Him  for He careth for you.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: My life is ... a mystery which I do not attempt to really understand  as though 1 were led by the hand in a night where I see nothing  but can fully depend on the love and protection of Him who guides me.
data.author: Thomas Merton

data.quote: Be like the bird that  passing on her flight awhile on boughs too slight  feels them give way beneath her  and yet sings  knowing that she hath wings.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: I come to the office each morning and stay for long hours doing what has to be done to the best of my ability. And when you've done the best you can  you can't do any better. So when I go to sleep I turn everything over to the Lord and forget it.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: Even now I am full of hope  but the end lies in God.
data.author: Pindar

data.quote: Let us do or die.
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: Did nothing in particular And did it very well.
data.author: W. S. Gilbert

data.quote: He started to sing as he tackled the thing That couldn't be done  and he did it.
data.author: Edgar A. Guest

data.quote: Do well and right  and let the world sink.
data.author: George Edward Herbert

data.quote: Trust no future  howe'er pleasant! Let the dead past bury its dead! Act   - act in the living Present! Heart within and God o'erhead.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Let us then be up and doing  With a heart for any fate  Still achieving  still pursuing  Learn to labor and to wait.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Every man feels instinctively that all the beautiful sentiments in the world weigh less than a single lovely action.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: He nothing common did  or mean  Upon that memorable scene.
data.author: Andrew Marvell

data.quote: Go  and do thou likewise.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: So much to do  so little done.
data.author: Cecil Rhodes

data.quote: Get good counsel before you begin: and when you have decided  act promptly.
data.author: Sallust

data.quote: He that is overcautious will accomplish little.
data.author: Friedrich von Schiller

data.quote: What's done can't be undone.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Heaven ne'er helps the men who will not act.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: Theirs not to make reply  Theirs not to reason why  Theirs but to do and die.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: Out of the strain of the doing  Into the peace of the done.
data.author: Julia Woodruff

data.quote: Adam and Eve had many advantages  but the principal one was that they escaped teething.
data.author: S. L. Clemens

data.quote: Whilst Adam slept  Eve from his side arose  Strange his first sleep would be his last repose.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: When Adam dolve  and Eve span  Who was then the gentleman?
data.author: John Ball

data.quote: When Eve upon the first of men The apple pressed with specious cant  Oh! what a thousand pities then That Adam was not adamant.
data.author: Thomas Hood

data.quote: Adam ate the apple  and our teeth still ache.
data.author: Hungarian proverb

data.quote: In Adam's fall -  We sinned all.
data.author: New England Primer

data.quote: Admiration is a very short-lived passion  that immediately decays upon growing familiar with its object.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: Our polite recognition of another's resemblance to ourselves.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Distance is a great promoter of admiration!
data.author: Denis Diderot

data.quote: We always love those who admire us  and we do not always love those whom we admire.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: For fools admire  but men of sense approve.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: An earthquake achieves what the law promises but does not in practice maintain - the equality of all men.
data.author: Ignazio Silone

data.quote: I don't deserve this award  but I have arthritis and I don't deserve that either.
data.author: Jack Benny

data.quote: I have an inward treasure born within me  which can keep me alive if all the extraneous delights should be withheld  or offered only at a price I cannot afford.
data.author: Charlotte Bronte

data.quote: Nothing is more desirable than to be released from an affliction  but nothing is more frightening than to be divested of a crutch.
data.author: James Baldwin

data.quote: People don't ever seem to realize that doing what's right is no guarantee against misfortune.
data.author: William McFee

data.quote: The struggle to the top is in itself enough to fulfill the human heart. Sisyphus should be regarded as happy.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: There are three modes of bearing the ills of life: by indifference  by philosophy and by religion.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Weeping may endure for a night  but joy cometh in the morning.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Night brings our troubles to the light rather than banishes them.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: Too much happens ... Man performs  engenders so much more than he can or should have to bear. That's how he finds that he can bear anything.
data.author: William Faulkner

data.quote: A great man does not lose his self-possession when he is afflicted  the ocean is not made muddy by the falling in of its banks.
data.author: Panchatantra

data.quote: I've had an unhappy life  thank God.
data.author: Russell Baker

data.quote: Do not show your wounded finger  for everything will knock up against it.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: They sicken of the calm that know the storm.
data.author: Dorothy Parker

data.quote: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
data.author: Henry J. Kaiser

data.quote: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience  but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: Great occasions do not make heroes or cowards  they simply unveil them to the eyes of men. Silently and imperceptibly  as we wake or sleep  we grow strong or weak  and at last some crisis shows what we have become.
data.author: Brooke Foss Westcott

data.quote: What does not destroy me  makes me strong.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: I long ago came to the conclusion that all life is six to five against.
data.author: Damon Runyon

data.quote: (Adversity is) the state in which a man most easily becomes acquainted with himself  being especially free from admirers then.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Adversity has the same effect on a man that severe training has on the pugilist - it reduces him to his fighting weight.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: From a fallen tree  all make kindling.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: The virtue of prosperity is temperance  the virtue of adversity is fortitude  which in morals is the heroical virtue.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: No untroubled day has ever dawned for me.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: You can't have more bugs than a blanketful.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: Even in the deepest sinking there is the hidden purpose of an ultimate rising. Thus it is for all men  from none is the source of light withheld unless he himself withdraws from it. Therefore the most important thing is not to despair.
data.author: Hasidic saying

data.quote: Trouble will rain on those who are already wet.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: They say a reasonable amount o' fleas is good for a dog - it keeps him from broodin' over bein' a dog mebbe.
data.author: Edward Noyes Westcott

data.quote: There is nothing the body suffers which the soul may not profit by.
data.author: George Meredith

data.quote: The burden is equal to the horse's strength.
data.author: The Talmud

data.quote: Nothing befalls a man except what is in his nature to endure.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: I am escaped by the skin of my teeth.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Prosperity tries the fortunate  adversity the great.
data.author: Pliny the Younger

data.quote: Be willing to have it so  acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequences of any misfortune.
data.author: William James

data.quote: If all our misfortunes were laid in one common heap  whence every one must take an equal portion  most people would be content to take their own and depart.
data.author: Solon

data.quote: I never knew any man in my life who could not bear another's misfortunes perfectly like a Christian.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: When the world has once begun to use us ill  it afterwards continues the same treatment with less scruple or ceremony  as men do to a whore.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there?
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Every difficulty slurred over will be a ghost to disturb your repose later on.
data.author: Fridiric Chopin

data.quote: Fire tries gold  misfortune men.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The fiery trials through which we pass will light us down in honour or dishonour to the latest generation.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Thou hast shown thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: A wounded deer leaps the highest.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: The difficulties which I meet with in order to realize my existence are precisely what awaken and mobilize my activities  my capacities.
data.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: Whenever there is chaos  it creates wonderful thinking. I consider chaos a gift.
data.author: Septima Poinsette Clark

data.quote: I have always been pushed by the negative.... The apparent failure of a play sends me back to my typewriter that very night  before the reviews are out. I am more compelled to get back to work than if I had a success.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: What we want is never simple.
data.author: Linda Pastan

data.quote: For me life is a challenge. And it will be a challenge if I live to be a hundred or if I get to be a trillionaire.
data.author: Beah Richards

data.quote: To be thrown upon one's own resources is to be cast into the very lap of fortune  for our faculties then undergo a development and display an energy of which they were previously unsusceptible.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Every failure made me more confident. Because I wanted even more to achieve things  as revenge. To show that I could.
data.author: Roman Polanski

data.quote: Adversity is  to me at least  a tonic and a bracer.
data.author: Sir Walter Scott

data.quote: Difficulties should act as a tonic. They should spur us to greater exertion.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: There are times in everyone's life when something constructive is born out of adversity ... when things seem so bad that you've got to grab your fate by the shoulders and shake it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Brave men rejoice in adversity  just as brave soldiers triumph in war.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Some minds seem almost to create themselves  springing up under every disadvantage and working their solitary but irresistible way through a thousand obstacles.
data.author: Washington Irving

data.quote: Every calamity is a spur and valuable hint.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Treasure the memories of past misfortunes  they constitute our bank of fortitude.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: If you will call your troubles experiences  and remember that every experience develops some latent force within you  you will grow vigorous and happy  however adverse your circumstances may seem to be.
data.author: John Heywood

data.quote: Necessity is often the spur to genius.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: Necessity is the mother of "taking chances."
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Necessity makes even the timid brave.
data.author: Sallust

data.quote: People wish to be settled  only as far as they are unsettled is there any hope for them.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Difficulties are meant to rouse  not discourage. The human spirit is to grow strong by conflict.
data.author: William Ellery Channing

data.quote: Adversity causes some men to break  others to break records.
data.author: William A. Ward

data.quote: I think there is this about the great troubles - they teach us the art of cheerfulness  whereas the small ones cultivate the industry of discontent.
data.author: Mary Adams

data.quote: Opposition inflames the enthusiast  never converts him.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: The thought that we are enduring the unendurable is one of the things that keeps us going.
data.author: Molly Haskell

data.quote: If you do things well  do them better. Be daring  be first  be different  be just.
data.author: Anita Roddick

data.quote: A certain amount of opposition is a great help to a man  it is what he wants and must have to be good for anything. Hardship and opposition are the native soil of manhood and self-reliance.
data.author: John Neal

data.quote: Difficulties  opposition  criticism -  these things are meant to be overcome  and there is a special joy in facing them and in coming out on top. It is only when there is nothing but praise that life loses its charm and I begin to wonder what I should do about it.
data.author: Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit

data.quote: They sicken of calm  who know the storm.
data.author: Dorothy Parker

data.quote: Without the burden of afflictions it is impossible to reach the height of grace. The gift of grace increases as the struggles increase.
data.author: Saint Rose of Lima

data.quote: When the going gets tough  the tough get going.
data.author: Frank Leahy

data.quote: The effects of opposition are wonderful. There are men who rise refreshed on hearing of a threat  men to whom a crises  which intimidates and paralyzes the majority  comes as graceful and beloved as a bride!
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Remember that the Devil doesn't sleep  but seeks our ruin in a thousand different ways
data.author: Angela Merici

data.quote: Down you mongrel  Death! Back into your kennel!
data.author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

data.quote: He that wrestles with us strengthens our nerves and sharpens our skills. Our antagonist is our helper.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: The block of granite which was an obstacle in the path of the weak becomes a steppingstone in the path of the strong.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Strong people are made by opposition  like kites that go up against the wind.
data.author: Frank Harris

data.quote: Men strive for peace  but it is their enemies that give them strength  and I think if man no longer had enemies  he would have to invent them  for his strength only grows from struggle.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: You'll never find a better sparring partner than adversity.
data.author: Walt Schmidt

data.quote: The English nation is never so great as in adversity.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Enemies can be an incentive to survive and become someone in spite of them. Enemies can keep you alert and aware.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: Problems are the cutting edge that distinguishes between success and failure. Problems ... create our courage and wisdom.
data.author: M. Scott Peck

data.quote: It is often better to have a great deal of harm happen to one than a little  a great deal may rouse you to remove what a little will only accustom you to endure.
data.author: Grenville Kleiser

data.quote: When things come to the worse  they generally mend.
data.author: Susanna Moodie

data.quote: Things have got to be wrong in order that they may be deplored.
data.author: Whitney Griswold

data.quote: Remorse begets reform.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: "The world is a wheel always turning " philosophized Mrs. Pelz. "Those who were high go down low  and those who've been low go up higher."
data.author: Anzia Yezierska

data.quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
data.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

data.quote: It constantly happens that the Lord permits a soul to fall so that it may grow humbler.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: In order to change  we must be sick and tired of being sick and tired.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I have been in sorrow's kitchen and licked out all the pots. Then I have stood on the peaky mountain wrapped in rainbows  with a harp and sword in my hands.
data.author: Zora Neale Hurston

data.quote: There is often in people to whom "the worst" has happened an almost transcendent freedom  for they have faced "the worst" and survived it.
data.author: Carol Pearson

data.quote: I didn't know I'd have to be torn down before I could be built up.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Suffering! ... We owe to it all that is good in us  all that gives value to life  we owe to it pity  we owe to it courage  we owe to it all the virtues.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: It is only the women whose eyes have been washed clear with tears who get the broad vision that makes them little sisters to all the world.
data.author: Dorothy Dix

data.quote: Much of your pain is the bitter potion by which the physician within you heals your sick self.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: Man cannot remake himself without suffering  for he is both the marble and the sculptor.
data.author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

data.quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls  the most massive characters are seared with scars.
data.author: Edwin H. Chapin

data.quote: The pain of love is the pain of being alive. It is a perpetual wound.
data.author: Maureen Duffy

data.quote: There is no coming to consciousness without pain.
data.author: Carl Jung

data.quote: Everybody's heart is open  you know  when they have recently escaped from severe pain  or are recovering the blessing of health.
data.author: Jane Austen

data.quote: Suffering is the sole origin of consciousness.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

data.quote: Pain makes man think. Thought makes man wise. Wisdom makes life endurable.
data.author: John Patrick

data.quote: Time engraves our faces with all the tears we have not shed.
data.author: Natalie Clifford Barney

data.quote: Suffering raises up those souls that are truly great  it is only small souls that are made mean-spirited by it.
data.author: Alexandra David-Neel

data.quote: To live is to suffer  to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
data.author: Roberta Flack

data.quote: If you suffer  thank God! It is a sure sign that you are alive.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Suffering is also one of the ways of knowing you're alive.
data.author: Jessamyn West

data.quote: Don't look forward to the day when you stop suffering. Because when it comes  you'll know you're dead.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: How sublime a thing it is to suffer and be strong.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: He disposes Doom who hath suffered him.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: They merit more praise who know how to suffer misery than those who temper themselves in contentment.
data.author: Pietro Aretino

data.quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened  vision cleared  ambition inspired  and success achieved.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Never to suffer would have been never to have been blessed.
data.author: Edgar Allan Poe

data.quote: It is somehow reassuring to discover that the word "travel" is derived from "travail " denoting the pains of childbirth.
data.author: Jessica Mitford

data.quote: True knowledge comes only through suffering.
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: Suffering raises up those souls that are truly great  it is only small souls that are made mean-spirited by it.
data.author: Alexandra David-Neel

data.quote: He disposes Doom who hath suffered him.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Suffering has always been with us  does it really matter in what form it comes? All that matters is how we bear it and how we fit it into our lives.
data.author: Etty Hillesum

data.quote: We are healed of a suffering only by experiencing it to the full.
data.author: Marcel Proust

data.quote: Those who have suffered understand suffering and therefore extend their hand.
data.author: Patti Smith

data.quote: The saints rejoiced at injuries and persecutions  because in forgiving them they had something to present to God when they prayed to Him.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: The difficulties and struggles of today are but the price we must pay for the accomplishments and victories of tomorrow.
data.author: William J. H. Boetcker

data.quote: Experience may be hard but we claim its gifts because they are real  even though our feet bleed on its stones.
data.author: Mary Parker Follett

data.quote: And I think that's important  to know how the water's gone over the dam before you start to describe it. It helps to have been over the dam yourself.
data.author: E. Annie Proulx

data.quote: I think these difficult times have helped me to understand better than before how infinitely rich and beautiful life is in every way that so many things that one goes around worrying about are of no importance whatsoever.
data.author: Isak Dinesen

data.quote: Problems are the price of progress. Don't bring me anything but trouble.
data.author: Charles F. Kettering

data.quote: Trouble is the thing that strong men grow by. Met in the right way  it is a sure-fire means of putting iron into the victim's will and making him a tougher man to down forever after.
data.author: H. Bertram Lewis

data.quote: Every time you meet a situation  though you think at the time it is an impossibility and you go through the torture of the damned  once you have met it and lived through it  you find that forever after you are freer than you were before.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: I have always fought for ideas - until I learned that it isn't ideas but grief  struggle  and flashes of vision which enlighten.
data.author: Margaret Anderson

data.quote: I have learned in the great University of Hard Knocks a philosophy that no woman who has had an easy life ever acquires. I have learned to live each day as it comes  and not to borrow trouble by dreading tomorrow. It is the dark menace of the future that makes cowards of us.
data.author: Dorothy Dix

data.quote: Discontent and disorder were signs of energy and hope  not of despair.
data.author: C. V. Wedgwood

data.quote: We say: mad with joy. We should say: wise with grief.
data.author: Marguerite Yourcenar

data.quote: There are some things you learn best in calm  and some in storm.
data.author: Willa Cather

data.quote: Discontent is the first step in the progress of a man or a nation.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Were there none who were discontented with what they have  the world would never reach anything better.
data.author: Florence Nightingale

data.quote: Woman's discontent increases in exact proportion to her development.
data.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

data.quote: Restlessness is discontent  and discontent is the first necessity of progress.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: Noble discontent is the path to heaven.
data.author: Thomas W. Higginson

data.quote: No pain  no palm  no thorns  no throne  no gall  no glory  no cross  no crown.
data.author: William Penn

data.quote: Times of stress and difficulty are seasons of opportunity when the seeds of progress are sown.
data.author: Thomas F. Woodlock

data.quote: The gem cannot be polished without friction  nor man perfected without trials.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: As there is no worldly gain without some loss  so there is no worldly loss without some gain.... Set the allowance against the loss  and thou shalt find no loss great.
data.author: Francis Quarles

data.quote: Never complain about your troubles  they are responsible for more than half of your income.
data.author: Robert R. Updegraff

data.quote: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
data.author: Duke Ellington

data.quote: Emergencies have always been necessary to progress. It was darkness which produced the lamp. It was fog that produced the compass. It was hunger that drove us to exploration. And it took a depression to teach us the real value of a job.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Many men owe the grandeur of their lives to their tremendous difficulties.
data.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

data.quote: It is often hard to distinguish between the hard knocks in life and those of opportunity.
data.author: Frederick Phillips

data.quote: Fire is the test of gold  adversity of strong men.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: I think my biggest achievement is that after going through a rather difficult time  I consider myself comparatively sane. I'm proud of that.
data.author: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

data.quote: To be tested is good. The challenged life may be the best therapist.
data.author: Gail Sheehy

data.quote: I think hearts are very much like glasses - if they do not break with the first ring  they usually last a considerable time.
data.author: L. E. Landon

data.quote: Your first big trouble can be a bonanza if you live through it. Get through the first trouble  and you'll probably make it through the next one.
data.author: Ruth Gordon

data.quote: Calamity is the test of integrity.
data.author: Richardson

data.quote: The secret of a leader lies in the tests he has faced over the whole course of his life and the habit of action he develops in meeting those tests.
data.author: Gail Sheehy

data.quote: The fiery trials through which we pass will light us down in honor or dishonor to the last generation.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Our trials are tests  our sorrows pave the way for a fuller life when we have earned it.
data.author: Jerome P. Fleishman

data.quote: Times of general calamity and confusion have ever been productive of the greatest minds. The purist ore is produced from the hottest furnace  and the brightest thunderbolt is elicited from the darkest storms.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: The habits of a vigorous mind are formed in contending with difficulties.
data.author: Abigail Adams

data.quote: A diamond is a chunk of coal that made good under pressure.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A clay pot sitting in the sun will always be a clay pot. It has to go through the white heat of the furnace to become porcelain.
data.author: Mildred W. Struven

data.quote: It is the surmounting of difficulties that makes heroes.
data.author: Kossuth

data.quote: Men habitually use only a small part of the powers which they possess and which they might use under appropriate circumstances.
data.author: William James

data.quote: It is the north wind that lashes men into Vikings  it is the soft  luscious south wind which lulls them to lotus dreams.
data.author: Ouida

data.quote: It is grief that develops the powers of the mind.
data.author: Marcel Proust

data.quote: Unless a man has been kicked around a little  you can't really depend upon him to amount to anything.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: Troubles cured you salty as a country ham  smoky to the taste  thick-skinned and tender inside.
data.author: Marge Piercy

data.quote: If you have to be careful because of oppression and censorship  this pressure produces diamonds.
data.author: Tatyana Tolstaya

data.quote: Adversity is another way to measure the greatness of individuals. I never had a crisis that didn't make me stronger.
data.author: Lou Holtz

data.quote: It is not in the still calm of life  or the repose of a pacific station  that great characters are formed. ... Great necessities call out great virtues.
data.author: Abigail Adams

data.quote: Of all the advantages which come to any young man ... poverty is the greatest.
data.author: Josiah G. Holland

data.quote: My luck was my father not striking oil... we'd have been rich. I'd never have set out for Hollywood with my camera  and I'd have had a lot less interesting life.
data.author: King Vidor

data.quote: [A difficult childhood gave me] a kind of cocky confidence. ... I could never have so little that I hadn't had less. It took away my fear.
data.author: Jacqueline Cochran

data.quote: If you have been sunned through and through like an apricot on a wall from your earliest days  you are oversensitive to any withdrawal of heat.
data.author: Margot Asquith

data.quote: I was lucky I wasn't a better boxer  or that's what I'd be now - a punchy ex-pug.
data.author: Bob Hope

data.quote: At every step the child should be allowed to meet the real experience of life  the thorns should never be plucked from his roses.
data.author: Ellen Key

data.quote: Hot water is my native element. I was in it as a baby  and I have never seemed to get out of it ever since.
data.author: Edith Sitwell

data.quote: When I was very young  I tried selling used cars. It didn't last long. I guess that was my good luck too  that I didn't show more promise at it  or I might have been an automobile dealer.
data.author: King Vidor

data.quote: Supporting myself at an early age was the best training for life I could have possibly received.
data.author: Lea Thompson

data.quote: In my youth  poverty enriched me  but now I can afford wealth.
data.author: Marc Chagall

data.quote: I'm very grateful that I was too poor to get to art school until I was 21. ... I was old enough when I got there to know how to get something out of it.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: The most valuable gift I ever received was ... the gift of insecurity ... my father left us. My mother's love might not have prepared me for life the way my father's departure did. He forced us out on the road  where we had to earn our bread.
data.author: Lillian Gish

data.quote: Americans are like a rich father who wishes he knew how to give his sons the hardships that made him rich.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: I would never have amounted to anything were it not for adversity. I was forced to come up the hard way.
data.author: J. C. Penney

data.quote: Adversity introduces a man to himself.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I thank God for my handicaps for  through them  I have found myself  my work  and my God.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: When one's own problems are unsolvable and all best efforts are frustrated  it is lifesaving to listen to other people's problems.
data.author: Suzanne Massie

data.quote: This struggle of people against their conditions  this is where you find the meaning in life.
data.author: Rose Chernin

data.quote: Adversity has ever been considered as the state in which a man most easily becomes acquainted with himself  being free from flatterers.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: In all things preserve integrity  and the consciousness of thine own uprightness will alleviate the toil of business  soften the hardness of ill-success and disappointments  and give thee an humble confidence before God  when the ingratitude of man  or the iniquity of the times may rob thee of other rewards.
data.author: Barbara Paley

data.quote: He knows not his own strength who hath not met adversity.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Adversity leads us to think properly of our state  and so is most beneficial to us.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: In the depth of winter  I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Who hath not known ill fortune  never knew himself  or his own virtue.
data.author: David Mallett

data.quote: Adversity is the trial of principle. Without it a man hardly knows whether he is honest or not.
data.author: Henry Fielding

data.quote: I think the years I have spent in prison have been the most formative and important in my life because of the discipline  the sensations  but chiefly the opportunity to think clearly  to try to understand things.
data.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

data.quote: We only really face up to ourselves when we are afraid.
data.author: Thomas Bernhard

data.quote: Difficulties are things that show what men are.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Even if misfortune is only good for bringing a fool to his senses  it would still be just to deem it good for something.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: Never does a man know the force that is in him till some mighty affection or grief has humanized the soul.
data.author: Frederick W. Robertson

data.quote: Disappointment is the nurse of wisdom.
data.author: Sir Boyle Roche

data.quote: Challenges make you discover things about yourself that you never really knew. They're what make the instrument stretch  what make you go beyond the norm.
data.author: Cicely Tyson

data.quote: A woman is like a tea bag: you never know her strength until you drop her in hot water.
data.author: Nancy Reagan

data.quote: Trouble brings experience  and experience brings wisdom.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A woman has got to love a bad man once or twice in her life to be thankful for a good one.
data.author: Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings

data.quote: Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents  which  in prosperous circumstances  would have lain dormant.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Adversity is a severe instructor. ... He that wrestles with us strengthens our nerves and sharpens our skill. Our antagonist is our helper.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: Experience is a good teacher  but she sends in terrific bills.
data.author: Minna Antrim

data.quote: Forget the times of your distress  but never forget what they taught you.
data.author: Herbert Gasser

data.quote: You can learn little from victory. You can learn everything from defeat.
data.author: Christy Mathewson

data.quote: A smooth sea never made a skillful mariner.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: When a man is pushed  tormented  defeated  he has a chance to learn something  he has been put on his wits ... he has gained facts  learned his ignorance  is cured of the insanity of conceit  has got moderation and real skill.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: From their errors and mistakes  the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: By becoming more unhappy  we sometimes learn how to be less so.
data.author: Madame Swetchine

data.quote: Every experience  however bitter  has its lesson  and to focus one's attention on the lesson helps one overcome the bitterness.
data.author: Edward Howard Griggs

data.quote: A good scare is worth more to a man than good advice.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: It is from the level of calamities ... that we learn impressive and useful lessons.
data.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

data.quote: When I have listened to my mistakes  I have grown.
data.author: Hugh Prather

data.quote: We only think when we are confronted with a problem.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: Adversity comes with instruction in its hand.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Mistakes are often the best teachers.
data.author: James A. Froude

data.quote: Pain  indolence  sterility  endless ennui have also their lesson for you.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Prosperity is a great teacher  adversity is a greater. Possession pampers the mind  privation trains and strengthens it.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Wisdom comes by disillusionment.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: You have learned something. That always feels at first as if you had lost something.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: I have always grown from my problems and challenges  from the things that don't work out. That's when I've really learned.
data.author: Carol Burnett

data.quote: Those things that hurt  instruct.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Pain is the root of knowledge.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: Life can be real tough ... you can either learn from your problems  or keep repeating them over and over.
data.author: Marie Osmond

data.quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Prosperity is not without many fears and distastes  and adversity is not without comforts and hopes.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: If we had no winter  the spring would not be so pleasant  if we did not sometimes taste of adversity  prosperity would not be so welcome.
data.author: Anne Bradstreet

data.quote: The good things that belong to prosperity are to be wished  but the good things that belong to adversity are to be admired.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: One who was adored by all in prosperity is abhorred by all in adversity.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: Prosperity provideth  but adversity proveth friends.
data.author: Queen Elizabeth I

data.quote: The human race has had long experience and a fine tradition in surviving adversity. But we now face a task for which we have little experience  the task of surviving prosperity.
data.author: Alan Gregg

data.quote: Adversity reveals genius  prosperity conceals it.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: The virtue of prosperity is temperance  the virtue of adversity is fortitude.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: In the day of prosperity be joyful  but in the day of adversity consider.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: In victory even the cowardly like to boast  while in adverse times even the brave are discredited.
data.author: Sallust

data.quote: Adversity is sometimes hard upon a man  but for one man who can stand prosperity  there are a hundred that will stand adversity.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Some knowledge and some song and some beauty must be kept for those days before the world again plunges into darkness.
data.author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

data.quote: There is not enough darkness in all the world to put out the light of even one small candle.
data.author: Robert Alden

data.quote: Hope begins in the dark  the stubborn hope that if you just show up and try to do the right thing  the dawn will come. You wait and watch and work: you don't give up.
data.author: Anne Lamott

data.quote: Truth  like the burgeoning of a bulb under the soil  however deeply sown  will make its way to the light.
data.author: Ellis Peters

data.quote: Flowers grow out of dark moments.
data.author: Corita Kent

data.quote: I have brightness in my soul  which strains toward Heaven. I am like a bird!
data.author: Jenny Lind

data.quote: When it is dark enough  you can see the stars.
data.author: Charles A. Beard

data.quote: All sorts of spiritual gifts come through privations  if they are accepted.
data.author: Janet Erskine Stuart

data.quote: There is nothing the body suffers which the soul may not profit by.
data.author: George Meredith

data.quote: Often God has to shut a door in our face  so that He can subsequently open the door through which He wants us to go.
data.author: Catharine Marshall

data.quote: God will not look you over for medals  degrees or diplomas  but for scars.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: He who serves God with what costs him nothing  will do very little service  you may depend on it.
data.author: Susan Warner

data.quote: There are three modes of bearing the ills of life: by indifference  by philosophy  and by religion.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Sorrow has its reward. It never leaves us where it found us.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: The same reason makes a man a religious enthusiast that makes a man an enthusiast in any other way: an uncomfortable mind in an uncomfortable body.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Adversity introduces a man to himself.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Constant success shows us but one side of the world  adversity brings out the reverse of the picture.
data.author: Walter Colton

data.quote: Prosperity is a great teacher  adversity is a greater. Possession pampers the mind  privation trains and strengthens it.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Sweet are the uses of adversity  Which  like the toad  ugly and venomous  Wears yet a precious jewel in his head.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: There is no education like adversity.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: The incessant witless repetition of advertisers' moron-fodder has become so much a part of life that if we are not careful  we forget to be insulted by it.
data.author: The London Times

data.quote: There is no such thing as bad publicity except your own obituary.
data.author: Brendan Behan

data.quote: The advertisements in a newspaper are more full of knowledge in respect to what is going on in a state or community than the editorial columns are.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: If it doesn't sell  it isn't creative.
data.author: David Ogilvy

data.quote: In advertising not to be different is virtually suicidal.
data.author: Bill Bernback

data.quote: Advertising - a judicious mixture of flattery and threats.
data.author: Northrop Frye

data.quote: Advertising may be described as the science of arresting the human intelligence long enough to get money from it.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: The best ad is a good product.
data.author: Alan H. Meyer

data.quote: The philosophy behind much advertising is based on the old observation that every man is really two men - the man he is and the man he wants to be.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: The number of agency people required to shoot a commercial on location is in direct proportion to the mean temperature of the location.
data.author: Shelby Page

data.quote: Advertising is the most fun you can have with your clothes on.
data.author: Jerry Delia Femina

data.quote: Buy me and you will overcome the anxieties I have just reminded you of.
data.author: Michael Schudson

data.quote: If I were starting life over again  I am inclined to think that I would go into the advertising business in preference to almost any other. The general raising of standards of modern civilization among all groups of people during the past half-century would have been impossible without that spreading of the knowledge of higher standards by means of advertising.
data.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

data.quote: Promise  large promise  is the soul of an advertisement.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The deeper problems connected with advertising come less from the unscrupulousness of our 'deceivers' than from our pleasure in being deceived  less from the desire to seduce than from the desire to be seduced.
data.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

data.quote: Ads are the cave art of the twentieth century.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: The advertisement is one of the most interesting and difficult of modern literary forms.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: What kills a skunk is the publicity it gives itself.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Few people at the beginning of the nineteenth century needed an adman to tell them what they wanted.
data.author: J. K. Galbraith

data.quote: The art of publicity is a black art.
data.author: Learned Hand

data.quote: Advertising is legalized lying.
data.author: H. G. Wells

data.quote: Advertising is what you do when you can't go to see somebody. That's all it is.
data.author: Fairfax Cone

data.quote: The consumer is not a moron. She's your wife.
data.author: David Ogilvy

data.quote: When business is good it pays to advertise  when business is bad you've got to advertise.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: You can tell the ideals of a nation by its advertisements.
data.author: George Norman Douglas

data.quote: Advertisements contain the only truth to be relied on in a newspaper.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: But one must know where one stands  and where the others wish to go.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: No man ever listened himself out of a job.
data.author: Calvin Coolidge

data.quote: Thanksgiving comes after Christmas.
data.author: Peter Kreeft

data.quote: The proverb warns that  "You should not bite the hand that feeds you." But maybe you should  if it prevents you from feeding yourself.
data.author: Thomas Szasz

data.quote: I remember my father telling me the story of the preacher delivering an exhortation to his flock  and as he reached the climax of his exhortation  a man in the front row got up and said  'O Lord  use me. Use me  O Lord - in an advisory capacity!'
data.author: Adlai Stevenson

data.quote: Be frank and explicit. That is the right line to take when you wish to conceal your own mind and to confuse the minds of others.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: To make pleasure pleasant  shorten.
data.author: Charles Buxton

data.quote: Put all thine eggs in one basket and - watch that basket.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: It has seemed to be more necessary to have regard to the weight of words rather than to their number.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Don't offer me advice  give me money.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: If you aren't rich  you should always look useful.
data.author: Louis-Ferdinand Celine

data.quote: He who can lick can bite.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: When a man comes to me for advice  I find out the kind of advice he wants  and I give it to him.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: We only make a dupe of the friend whose advice we ask  for we never tell him all  and it is usually what we have left unsaid that decides our conduct.
data.author: Diane de Poitiers

data.quote: I give myself  sometimes  admirable advice  but I am incapable of taking it.
data.author: Mary Wortley Montagu

data.quote: Advice is like snow  the softer it falls  the longer it dwells upon  and the deeper it sinks into  the mind.
data.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

data.quote: The true secret of giving advice is  after you have honestly given it  to be perfectly indifferent whether it is taken or not and never persist in trying to set people right.
data.author: Hannah Whitall Smith

data.quote: 'Be yourself!' is about the worst advice you can give to some people.
data.author: Tom Masson

data.quote: A bull does not enjoy fame in two herds.
data.author: Rhodesian proverb

data.quote: The advice of the elders to young men is very apt to be as unreal as a list of the hundred best books.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Fewer things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: A good scare is worth more to a man than good advice.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: There is little serenity comparable to the serenity of the inexperienced giving advice to the experienced.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Advice is seldom welcome  and those who want it the most always like it the least.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: It is well enough  when one is talking to a friend  to lodge in an odd word by way of counsel now and then  but there is something mighty irksome in its staring upon one in a letter  where one ought to see only kind words and friendly remembrances.
data.author: Mary Lamb

data.quote: Men of much depth of mind can bear a great deal of counsel  for it does not easily deface their own character  nor render their purposes indistinct.
data.author: Arthur Helps

data.quote: Have more than thou showest  Speak less than thou knowest.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: What you don't see with your eyes  don't invent with your tongue.
data.author: Jewish proverb

data.quote: If you keep your mind sufficiently open  people will throw a lot of rubbish into it.
data.author: William A. Orton

data.quote: Don't fight forces  use them.
data.author: Buckminster Fuller

data.quote: Drink nothing without seeing it  sign nothing without reading it.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: What is important is to keep learning  to enjoy challenge  and to tolerate ambiguity. In the end there are no certain answers.
data.author: Marina Horner

data.quote: Simplicity  simplicity  simplicity. I say  let your affairs be as two or three  and not a hundred or a thousand  instead of a million count half a dozen  and keep your accounts on your thumbnail.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: You must not think  sir  to catch old birds with chaff.
data.author: Cervantes

data.quote: Never give advice in a crowd.
data.author: Arab proverb

data.quote: Never give advice unless asked.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: Whatever advice you give  be short.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Old men are fond of giving good advice  to console themselves for being no longer in a position to give bad examples.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: We give advice  but we do not inspire conduct.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Good counsel has no price.
data.author: Guiseppe Mazzini

data.quote: Never advise anyone to go to war or to marry.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: Many receive advice  only the wise profit by it.
data.author: Syrus

data.quote: Admonish your friends privately  but praise them openly.
data.author: Syrus

data.quote: The eternal stars shine out as soon as it is dark enough.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Be still  sad heart  and cease repining  Behind the clouds the sun is shining  Thy fate is the common fate of all  Into each life some rain must fall  -  Some days must be dark and dreary.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: It is always in season for old men to learn.
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: Youth is a blunder  Manhood a struggle  Old Age a regret.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: To know how to grow old is the master work of wisdom  and one of the most difficult chapters in the great art of living.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: Old wood best to burn  old wine to drink  old friends to trust  and old authors to read.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: At 20 years of age the will reigns  at 30 the wit  at 40 the judgment.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: If wrinkles must be written upon our brows  let them not be written upon the heart. The spirit should not grow old.
data.author: James A. Garfield

data.quote: The riders in a race do not stop short when they reach the goal. There is a little finishing canter before coming to a standstill. There is time to hear the kind voice of friends and to say to one's self: "The work is done."
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Study until twenty-five  investigation until forty  profession until sixty  at which age I would have him retired on a double allowance.
data.author: William Osier

data.quote: In youth the days are short and the years are long  in old age the years are short and the days long.
data.author: Panin

data.quote: The days of our years are threescore years and ten  and if by reason of strength they be fourscore years  yet is their strength labour and sorrow  for it is soon cut off  and we fly away.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The first forty years of life give us the text  the next thirty supply the commentary on it.
data.author: Schopenhauer

data.quote: Age cannot wither her  nor custom stale Her infinite variety.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: An old man is twice a child.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The old believe everything: the middle-aged suspect everything: the young know everything.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Age and treachery will triumph over youth and skill.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: All the best sands of my life are somehow getting into the wrong end of the hourglass. If I could only reverse it! Were it in my power to do so  would I?
data.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

data.quote: All would live long  but none would be old.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: An old man concludeth from his knowing mankind that they know him too  and that maketh him very wary.
data.author: George Saville

data.quote: An old man loved is Winter with flowers.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: An older author is constantly rediscovering himself in the more or less fossilized productions of his earlier years.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: But  Lord Crist! whan that it remembreth me Upon my yowthe  and on my jolitee  It tickleth me aboute myn herte roote. Unto this day it dooth myn herte boote That I have had my world as in my tyme. But age  alias! that al wole envenyme  Hath me biraft my beautee and my pith. Lat go  farewel! the devel go therwith! The flour is goon  ther is namoore to telle  The bren  as I best kan  now most I selle.
data.author: Geoffrey Chaucer

data.quote: Grow old with me! The best is yet to be  The last of life  for which the first was made: Our times are in his hands Who sayeth "a whole I plant  Youth shows but half  Trust God  see all nor be afraid."
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: Growing old is like being increasingly penalized for a crime you have not committed.
data.author: Anthony Powell

data.quote: Here's a new day. 0 Pendulum move slowly!
data.author: Harold Munro

data.quote: I am 65 and I guess that puts me in with the geriatrics. But if there were 15 months in every year  I'd only be 48. That's the trouble with us. We number everything. Take women  for example  I think they deserve to have more than 12 years between the ages of 28 and 40.
data.author: James Thurber

data.quote: I am just turning 40 and taking my time about it.
data.author: Harold Lloyd

data.quote: I haven't asked you to make me young again. All I want is to go on getting older.
data.author: Konrad Adenauer

data.quote: I refuse to admit that I am more than 52  even if that makes my sons illegitimate.
data.author: Nancy Lady Astor

data.quote: If I'd known I was gonna live this long (100 years)  I'd have taken better care of myself.
data.author: James Hubert Blake

data.quote: If the young only knew  if the old only could.
data.author: French saying

data.quote: Is it not strange that desire should so many years outlive performance?
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Middle age snuffs out more talent than even wars or sudden deaths do.
data.author: Richard Hughes

data.quote: Old age is the Outpatient's Dept of purgatory.
data.author: Lord Cecil

data.quote: Old age takes away from us what we have inherited and gives us what we have earned.
data.author: Gerald Brenan

data.quote: The difference between being an elder statesman And posing successfully as an elder statesman Is practically negligible.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: The old repeat themselves and the young have nothing to say. The boredom is mutual.
data.author: Jacques Bainville

data.quote: There is many a good tune played on an old fiddle.
data.author: Old saying

data.quote: Time goes by: reputation increases  ability declines.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled  to be hopeful  kindly  cheerful  reverent -that is to triumph over old age.
data.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

data.quote: We do not die wholly at our deaths: we have moldered away gradually long before. Faculty after faculty  interest after interest  attachment after attachment disappear: we are torn from ourselves while living.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Wrinkles - the service stripes of life.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: To be seventy years young is sometimes far more cheerful and hopeful than to be forty years old.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: One of the delights known to age  and beyond the grasp of youth  is that of 'not going'!
data.author: J. B. Priestley

data.quote: A man of sixty has spent twenty years in bed and over three years in eating.
data.author: Arnold Bennett

data.quote: The role of a retired person is no longer to possess one.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: Middle age: when you're sitting at home on Saturday night and the telephone rings and you hope it isn't for you.
data.author: Ogden Nash

data.quote: No Spring  nor Summer beauty hath such grace  As I have seen in one Autumnal face.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: If you live long enough the venerability factor creeps in  you get accused of things you never did and praised for virtues you never had.
data.author: I. F. Stone

data.quote: I advise you to go on living solely to enrage those who are paying your annuities. It is the only pleasure I have left.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy man has no time to form.
data.author: Andri Maurois

data.quote: Old age is an island surrounded by death.
data.author: Juan Montalvo

data.quote: It is time to be old  To take in sail.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I feel age like an icicle down my back.
data.author: Dyson Carter

data.quote: Old age is a time of humiliations  the most disagreeable of which  for me  is that I cannot work long at sustained high pressure with no leaks in concentration.
data.author: Igor Stravinsky

data.quote: Dignity  high station  or great riches are in some sort necessary to old men  in order to keep the younger at a distance  who are otherwise too apt to insult them upon the score of their age.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: The young feel tired at the end of an action  The old at the beginning.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: Old foxes want no tutors.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Old birds are hard to pluck.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: A man of fifty looks as old as Santa Claus to a girl of twenty.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?
data.author: Satchel Paige

data.quote: The young always have the same problem - how to rebel and conform at the same time. They have now solved this by defying their parents and copying one another.
data.author: Quentin Crisp

data.quote: Before you contradict an old man  my fair friend  you should endeavour to understand him.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: Zsa Zsa Gabor  when asked which of the Gabor women was the oldest  said "She'll never admit it  but I believe it is Mama." When men grow virtuous in their old age  they only make a sacrifice to God of the devil's leavings.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: When you are forty  half of you belongs to the past. . . And when you are seventy  nearly all of you.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: To an old man any place that's warm is homeland.
data.author: Maxim Gorky

data.quote: By the time a man gets well into his seventies his continued existence is a mere miracle.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: One trouble with growing older is that it gets progressively tougher to find a famous historical figure who didn't amount to much when he was your age.
data.author: Bill Vaughan

data.quote: Forty is the old age of youth  fifty is the youth of old age.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Middle age is youth without its levity  And age without decay.
data.author: Daniel Defoe

data.quote: And he (King David) died in a good old age  full of days  riches and honour.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I never dared be radical when young For fear it would make me conservative when old.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: Old age is by nature rather talkative.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Old age  especially an honoured old age  has so great authority  that this is of more value than all the pleasures of youth.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Age has a good mind and sorry shanks.
data.author: Pietro Aretino

data.quote: To me  old age is always fifteen years older than I am.
data.author: Bernard Baruch

data.quote: Few people know how to be old.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: First you forget names  then you forget faces  then you forget to pull your zipper up  then you forget to pull your zipper down.
data.author: Leo Rosenberg

data.quote: I really believe that more harm is done by old men who cling to their influence than by young men who anticipate it.
data.author: Owen D. Young

data.quote: He had come to that time in his life (it varies for every man) when a human being gives himself over to his demon or to his genius  according to a mysterious law which orders him either to destroy or to surpass himself.
data.author: Marguerite Yourcenar

data.quote: The individual succumbs  but he does not die if he has left something to mankind.
data.author: Will Durant

data.quote: It is always in season for old men to learn.
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: So  lively brisk old fellow  don't let age get you down. White hairs or not  you can still be a lover.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: He that has seen both sides of fifty has lived to little purpose if he has no other views of the world than he had when he was much younger.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: Let us respect gray hairs  especially our own.
data.author: J. P. Senn

data.quote: The spiritual eyesight improves as the physical eyesight declines.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: A man over ninety is a great comfort to all his elderly neighbours: he is a picket-guard at the extreme outpost: and the young folks of sixty and seventy feel that the enemy must get by him before he can come near their camp.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: An old codger  rampant  and still learning.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: A person is always startled when he hears himself seriously called an old man for the first time.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Many a man that couldn't direct ye to th' drug store on th' corner when he was thirty will get a respectful hearin' when age has further impaired his mind.
data.author: Finley Peter Dunne

data.quote: The denunciation of the young is a necessary part of the hygiene of older people  and greatly assists the circulation of their blood.
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: Never have I enjoyed youth so thoroughly as I have in my old age. In writing Dialogues in Limbo  The Last Puritan  and now all these descriptions of the friends of my youth and the young friends of my middle age  I have drunk the pleasure of life more pure  more joyful than it ever was when mingled with all the hidden anxieties and little annoyances of actual living. Nothing is inherently and invincibly young except spirit. And spirit can enter a human being perhaps better in the quiet of old age and dwell there more undisturbed than in the turmoil of adventure.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: The arctic loneliness of age.
data.author: S. Weir Mitchell

data.quote: When pain ends  gain ends too.
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: No gains without pains.
data.author: Adlai Stevenson

data.quote: Longevity is having a chronic disease and taking care of it.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Age is a high price to pay for maturity.
data.author: Tom Stoppard

data.quote: I'm very pleased with each advancing year. It stems back to when I was forty. I was a bit upset about reaching that milestone  but an older friend consoled me. 'Don't complain about growing old - many people don't have that privilege.'
data.author: Earl Warren

data.quote: When I was very young  I was disgracefully intolerant but when I passed the thirty mark I prided myself on having learned the beautiful lesson that all things were good  and equally good. That  however  was really laziness. Now  thank goodness  I've sorted out what matters and what doesn't. And I'm beginning to be intolerant again.
data.author: G. B. Stern

data.quote: It is the fear of being as dependent as a young child  while not being loved as a child is loved  but merely being kept alive against one's will.
data.author: Malcolm Cowley

data.quote: Happy the man who gains sagacity in youth  but thrice happy he who retains the fervour of youth in age.
data.author: Dagobert Runes

data.quote: Your old men shall dream dreams  your young men shall see visions.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I am long on ideas  but short on time. I expect to live only about a hundred years.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: How beautifully the leaves grow old. How full of light and colour are their last days.
data.author: John Burroughs

data.quote: In the last few years everything I'd done up to sixty or so has seemed very childish.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: What makes old age so sad is not that our joys but our hopes cease.
data.author: Jean Paul Richter

data.quote: The young man knows the rules but the old man knows the exceptions.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: To know how to grow old is the master-work of wisdom  and one of the most difficult chapters in the great art of living.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: When you reach your sixties  you have to decide whether you're going to be a sot or an ascetic. In other words if you want to go on working after you're sixty  some degree of asceticism is inevitable.
data.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

data.quote: Yes  I'm 68  but when I was a boy I was too poor to smoke  so knock off ten years. That makes me 58. And since I never developed the drinking habit  you can knock off ten more years. So I'm 48 - in the prime of my life. Retire? Retire to what?
data.author: W. A. C. Bennett

data.quote: Life has got to be lived - that's all there is to it. At seventy  I would say the advantage is that you take life more calmly. You know that 'this  too  shall pass!'
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Senescence begins And middle age ends  The day your descendants Outnumber your friends.
data.author: Ogden Nash

data.quote: On the day of his death  in his eightieth year  Elliot  'the Apostle of the Indians ' was found teaching an Indian child at his bedside. 'Why not to rest from your labours now?' asked a friend. 'Because ' replied the venerable man  'I have prayed God to render me useful in my sphere  and he has heard my prayers  for now that I can no longer preach  he leaves me strength enough to teach this poor child the alphabet.'
data.author: S. Chaplin

data.quote: As the world is wearie of me so am I of it.
data.author: John Knox

data.quote: Middle age is when you have a choice of two temptations and choose the one that will get you home earlier.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: No wise man ever wished to be younger.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Every man who has lived his life to the full should  by the time his senior years are reached  have established a reserve inventory of unfinished thinking.
data.author: Clarence Randall

data.quote: For the unlearned  old age is winter  for the learned  it is the season of the harvest.
data.author: Hasidic saying

data.quote: My opportunities were still there  nay  they multiplied tenfold  but the strength and youth to cope with them began to fail  and to need eking out with the shifty cunning of experience.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: I must be getting absent-minded. Whenever I complain that things aren't what they used to be  I always forget to include myself.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: We grow neither better nor worse as we get old  but more like ourselves
data.author: May Lamberton Becker

data.quote: Golden lads and girls all must  As chimney-sweepers  come to dust.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: It's never too late to have a fling For autumn is just as nice as spring And it's never too late to fall in love.
data.author: Sandy Wilson

data.quote: Growing old - it's not nice  but it's interesting.
data.author: August Strindberg

data.quote: If you think that I am going to bother myself again before I die about social improvement  or read any of those stinking upward and onwarders - you err - I mean to have some good out of being old.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: They tell you that you'll lose your mind when you grow older. What they don't tell you is that you won't miss it very much.
data.author: Malcolm Cowley

data.quote: I have learned little from the years that fly  but I have wrung the colour from the years.
data.author: Frances Pollock

data.quote: Earth is here so kind  that just tickle her with a hoe and she laughs with a harvest.
data.author: Douglas Jerrold

data.quote: A field becomes exhausted by constant tillage.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: Praise a large domain  cultivate a small estate.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: Blessed be agriculture! If one does not have too much of it.
data.author: Charles Dudley

data.quote: When tillage begins  other arts follow. The farmers  therefore  are the founders of human civilization.
data.author: Daniel Webster

data.quote: When you are aspiring to the highest place  it is honorable to reach the second or even the third rank.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Hitch your wagon to a star.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Better to reign in hell than serve in heaven.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: When that the poor have cried  Caesar hath wept: Ambition should be made of sterner stuff: Yet Brutus says he was ambitious  And Brutus is an honourable man.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: If you wish to reach the highest  begin at the lowest.
data.author: Syrus

data.quote: Ambition destroys its possessor.
data.author: Talmud

data.quote: Ambition has but one reward for all: A little power  a little transient fame  A grave to rest in  and a fading name!
data.author: William Winter

data.quote: There is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America.
data.author: President William J. Clinton

data.quote: The office of the president is such a bastardized thing  half royalty and half democracy  that nobody knows whether to genuflect or spit.
data.author: Jimmy Breslin

data.quote: Part of the American dream is to live long and die young.
data.author: Edgar Z. Friedenberg

data.quote: America is so vast that almost everything said about it is likely to be true  and the opposite is probably equally true.
data.author: James T. Farrell

data.quote: American youth attributes much more importance to arriving at driver's license age than at voting age.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: If ever there was an aviary overstocked with jays it is that Yaptown-on-the-Hudson called New York.
data.author: O. Henry

data.quote: If you don't want to use the army  I should like to borrow it for a while. Yours respectfully
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Let's talk sense to the American people. Let's tell them the truth  that there are no gains without pains.
data.author: Adlai Stevenson

data.quote: Ours is the country where  in order to sell your product  you don't so much point out its merits as you first work like hell to sell yourself.
data.author: Louis Kronenberger

data.quote: People who leave Washington D.C. do so by way of the box - ballot or coffin.
data.author: Claiborne Pell

data.quote: Poor Mexico  so far from God and so near to the United States.
data.author: Porfirio Diaz

data.quote: That strange blend of the commercial traveller  the missionary and the barbarian conqueror  which was the American abroad.
data.author: Olaf Stapledon

data.quote: The faces in New York remind me of people who played a game ! and lost.
data.author: Murray Kepton

data.quote: The President spends most of his time kissing people on the cheek in order to get them to do what they ought to do without getting kissed.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: The real America that Whitman proclaimed and Thoreau decoded.
data.author: Allen Ginsberg

data.quote: Thou  oh my country  hast thy foolish ways  Too apt to purr at every stranger's praise.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: You can always get the truth from an American statesman after he has turned 70  or given up all hope of the Presidency.
data.author: Wendell Phillips

data.quote: America is a willingness of the heart.
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

data.quote: (A country where) the young are always ready to give to those who are older than themselves the full benefits of their inexperience.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: We are now at the point where we must decide whether we are to honour the concept of a plural society which gains strength through diversity  or whether we are to have bitter fragmentation that will result in perpetual tension and strife.
data.author: Earl Warren

data.quote: Nothing ever gets settled in this town (Washington). It's not like running a company or even a university. It's a seething debating society  in which the debate never stops  in which people never give up  including me  and that's the atmosphere in which you administer.
data.author: George P. Shultz

data.quote: The skyline of New York is a monument of a splendour that no pyramids or palaces will ever equal or approach.
data.author: Ayn Rand

data.quote: Whoever wants to know the hearts and minds of America had better learn baseball.
data.author: Jacques Barzun

data.quote: Americans are like a rich father who wishes he knew how to give his son the hardships that made him rich.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: America... an economic system prouder of the distribution of its products than of the products themselves.
data.author: Murray Kempton

data.quote: The United States was born in the country and moved to the city in the nineteenth century.
