data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Delaware: a state that has three counties when the tide is out  and two when it is in.
data.author: J. J. Ingalls

data.quote: Washington is an endless series of mock palaces clearly built for clerks.
data.author: Ada Louise Huxtable

data.quote: The Americans believe they answered all first questions in 1776: since then they've just been hammering out the practical details.
data.author: Ray Smith

data.quote: Our national flower is the concrete cloverleaf.
data.author: Lewis Mumford

data.quote: Americans have a special horror of letting things happen their own way  without interference. They would like to jump down their stomachs  digest the food  and shovel the shit out.
data.author: William Burroughs

data.quote: When asked by an anthropologist what the Indians called America before the white man came  an Indian said simply 'Ours.'
data.author: Vine Deloria

data.quote: In the United States 'First' and 'Second' class can't be painted on railroad cars  for all passengers  being Americans  are equal and it would be 'unAmerican.' But paint 'Pullman' on a car and everyone is satisfied.
data.author: Owen Wister

data.quote: The true America is the Middle West  and Columbus discovered nothing at all except another Europe.
data.author: W. L. George

data.quote: America once had the clarity of a pioneer axe.
data.author: Robert Osborn

data.quote: In the United States there is more space where nobody is than where anybody is. This is what makes America what it is.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: You say to your soldier  'Do this' and he does it. But I am obliged to say to the American  'This is why you ought to do this' and then he does it.
data.author: Baron von Steuben

data.quote: The greatest American superstition is belief in facts.
data.author: Hermann Keyserling

data.quote: America should care more for its poor and reform itself in other ways  but even if it won't do those things  it remains the least constrained society on earth.
data.author: Robert M. Adams

data.quote: Florida: God's waiting room.
data.author: Glenn le Grice

data.quote: The Englishman is under no constitutional obligation to believe that all men are created equal. The American agony is therefore scarcely intelligible  like a saint's self-flagellation viewed by an atheist.
data.author: John Updike

data.quote: There is nothing the matter with Americans except their ideals. The real American is all right  it is the ideal American who is all wrong.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: Nobody ever went broke underestimating the taste of the American public.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: Good Americans  when they die  go to Paris.
data.author: Thomas Gold Appleton

data.quote: The sorrows and disasters of Europe always brought fortune to America.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: The American's conversation is much like his courtship ... He gives an inkling and watches for a reaction  if the weather looks fair  he inkles a little more. Wishing neither to intrude nor be intruded upon  he advances by stages of acceptance  by levels of agreement  by steps of concurrence.
data.author: Donald Lloyd

data.quote: The central fact of North American history is that there were fifteen British Colonies before 1776. Thirteen rebelled and two did not.
data.author: June Callwood

data.quote: A natural New Yorker is a native of the present tense.
data.author: V. S. Pritchett

data.quote: New York is notoriously inhospitable to the past  disowning it whenever it can.
data.author: John D. Rosenberg

data.quote: Why  if you're not in New York you are camping out.
data.author: Thomas W. Dewing

data.quote: That enfabled rock  that ship of life  that swarming  million-footed  tower-masted  sky-soaring citadel that bears the magic name of the Island of Manhattan.
data.author: Thomas Wolfe

data.quote: I don't like the life here in New York. There is no greenery. It would make a stone sick.
data.author: Nikita Khrushchev

data.quote: New York  the nation's thyroid gland.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: You will find the Americans much as the Greeks found the Romans: great  big  vulgar  bustling people more vigorous than we are and also more idle  with more unspoiled virtues but also more corrupt.
data.author: Harold Macmillan

data.quote: As for what you're calling hard luck - well  we made New England out of it. That and codfish.
data.author: Stephen Vincent Benet

data.quote: The lusts of the flesh can be gratified anywhere  it is not this sort of licence that distinguishes New York. It is  rather  a lust of the total ego for recognition  even for eminence. More than elsewhere  everybody here wants to be Somebody.
data.author: Sydney J. Harris

data.quote: After twenty annual visits  I am still surprised each time I return to see this giant asparagus bed of alabaster and rose and green skyscrapers.
data.author: Cecil Beaton

data.quote: He speaks English with the flawless imperfection of a New Yorker.
data.author: Gilbert Millstein

data.quote: A town that has no ceiling price  A town of double-talk  A town so big men name her twice  Like so: 'N'Yawk  N'Yawk.'
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: And this is good old Boston The home of the bean and the cod - Where the Lowells talk to the Cabots  And the Cabots talk only to God.
data.author: J. C. Bossidy

data.quote: New England is a finished place. Its destiny is that of Florence or Venice  not Milan  while the American empire careens onward toward its predicted end ... it is the first American section to be finished  to achieve stability in the conditions of its life. It is the first old civilization  the first permanent civilization in America.
data.author: Bernard de Voto

data.quote: A Bostonian - an American  broadly speaking.
data.author: G. E. Woodberry

data.quote: The swaggering underemphasis of New England.
data.author: Heywood Broun

data.quote: A well-established village in New England or the northern Middle-West could afford a town drunkard  a town atheist  and a few Democrats.
data.author: D. W. Brogan

data.quote: I shall enter on no encomium upon Massachussets  she needs none. There she is. Behold her  and judge for yourselves.
data.author: Daniel Webster

data.quote: The most serious charge which can be brought against New England is not Puritanism but February.
data.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

data.quote: Boston is a moral and intellectual nursery always busy applying first principles to trifles.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: America - the best poor man's country in the world.
data.author: William Allen

data.quote: Chicago - a facade of skyscrapers facing a lake and behind the facade every type of dubiousness.
data.author: E. M. Forster

data.quote: I'm from Indiana  the home of more first-rate second-class men than any other state in the union.
data.author: Thomas R. Marshall

data.quote: Pennsylvania  the state that has produced two great men: Benjamin Franklin of Massachusetts  and Albert Gallatin of Switzerland.
data.author: J. J. Ingalls

data.quote: Stormy  husky  brawling  City of the Big Shoulders.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: I come from a state that raises corn and cotton and cockleburs and Democrats  and frothy eloquence neither convinces nor satisfies me. I am from Missouri. You have got to show me.
data.author: Willard D. Vandiver

data.quote: Washington is a place where men praise courage and act on elaborate personal cost-benefit calculations.
data.author: J. K. Galbraith

data.quote: I think that New York is not the cultural centre of America  but the business and administrative centre of American culture.
data.author: Saul Bellow

data.quote: Washington is a city of people doing badly what shouldn't be done at all.
data.author: Robert H. Gurney

data.quote: America and its demons  Europe and its ghosts.
data.author: Le Monde

data.quote: 0 beautiful for patriot dream That sees beyond the years Thine alabaster cities gleam Undimmed by human tears! America! America! God shed his grace on thee  And crown thy good with brotherhood From sea to shining sea!
data.author: Katharine Lee Bates

data.quote: America is a country of young men.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Hail  Columbia! happy land! Hail  ye heroes! heavenborn band! Who fought and bled in Freedom's cause.
data.author: Joseph Hopkinson

data.quote: America is a tune. It must be sung together.
data.author: Gerald Stanley Lee

data.quote: Thou  too  sail on  O Shipof State! Sail on  O Union  strong and great! Humanity with all its fears  With all the hopes of future years  Is hanging breathless on thy fate!
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Only those Americans who are willing to die for their country are fit to live.
data.author: Douglas MacArthur

data.quote: I was born an American  I live an American  I shall die an American.
data.author: Daniel Webster

data.quote: Some Americans need hyphens in their names  because only part of them has come over  but when the whole man has come over  heart and thought and all  the hyphen drops of its own weight out of his name.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: This generation of Americans has a rendezvous with destiny.
data.author: F. D. Roosevelt

data.quote: America is God's crucible  the great Melting-Pot where all the races of Europe are melting and reforming!... The Real American has not yet arived. He is only in the crucible  Itell you - he will be the fusion of all races  the common superman.
data.author: Israel Zangwill

data.quote: A degenerate nobleman  or one that is proud of his birth  is like a turnip. There is nothing good of him but that which is underground.
data.author: Nicholas Murray Butler

data.quote: My father was a Creole  his father a Negro  and his father a monkey  my family  it seems  begins where yours left off.
data.author: Alexander Dumas

data.quote: There is no king who has not had a slave among his ancestors  and no slave who has not had a king among his.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Noble ancestry makes a poor dish at table.
data.author: Italian proverb

data.quote: Whoever serves his country well has no need of ancestors.

data.quote: A good indignation brings out all one's powers.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Anger makes dull men witty  but it keeps them poor.

data.quote: Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned  Nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
data.author: William Congreve

data.quote: Anger as soon as fed is dead - Tis starving makes it fat.

data.quote: Anger makes dull men witty  but it keeps them poor.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: An angry man opens his mouth and shuts up his eyes.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Never answer a letter while you are angry.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: When angry  count four  when very angry  swear.
data.author: Samuel L. Clemens

data.quote: Heav'n has no rage  like love to hatred turn'd  Nor Hell a fury  like a woman scorn'd.
data.author: William Congreve

data.quote: Beware the fury of a patient man.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: Anger is momentary madness  so control your passion or it will control you.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Anger blows out the lamp of the mind. In the examination of a great and important question  every one should be serene  slow-pulsed  and calm.
data.author: Charles J. Ingersoll

data.quote: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty  and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: A fence should be horse high  hog tight and bull strong.
data.author: Old saying

data.quote: A microbe is so very small You cannot make him out at all.
data.author: Hilaire Belloc

data.quote: Cats  no less liquid than their shadows  Offer no angles to the wind. They slip  diminished  Neat  through loopholes Less than themselves.
data.author: A. S. J. Tessimond

data.quote: Dogs come when they are called  cats take a message and get back to you.
data.author: Mary Bly

data.quote: Hi  handsome hunting man Fire your little gun Bang! Now the animal Is dead and dumb and done. Nevermore to peep again  creep again  leap again Eat or sleep or drink again. Oh  what fun.
data.author: Walter de la Mare

data.quote: I loathe people who keep dogs. They are cowards who haven't got the guts to bite people themselves.
data.author: August Strindberg

data.quote: If called by a panther Don't anther.
data.author: Ogden Nash

data.quote: Of all God's creatures there is only one that cannot be made the slave of the lash. That one is the cat. If man could be crossed with the cat  it would improve man  but it would deteriorate the cat.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: To hear the lark begin his flight  And singing startle the dull night. From his watchtower in the skies  Til the dappled dawn doth rise.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: Wee  sleekit  cow'rin  timrous beastie 0 what a panic's in thy breastie! Wi' bickering brattle!
data.author: Robert Burns

data.quote: The quizzical expression of the monkey at the zoo comes from his wondering whether he is his brother's keeper  or his keeper's brother.
data.author: Evan Esar

data.quote: You have now learned to see That cats are much like you and me And other people whom we find Possessed of various types of mind.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: No animal admires another animal.

data.quote: The great pleasure of a dog is that you may make a fool of yourself with him and not only will he not scold you  but he will make a fool of himself too.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: All animals are equal  but some animals are more equal than others.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: To his dog  every man is Napoleon  hence the constant popularity of dogs.

data.quote: Cats - a standing rebuke to behavioural scientists . . . least human of all creatures.
data.author: Lewis Thomas

data.quote: I'd rather have an inch of dog than miles of pedigree.

data.quote: Cats seem to go on the principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.
data.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

data.quote: Animals are such agreeable friends - they ask no questions  they pass no criticisms.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: I never saw a wild thing sorry for itself.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: A robin redbreast in a cage Sets all heaven in a rage.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: I think one reason we admire cats  those of us who do  is their proficiency in one-upmanship. They always seem to come out on top  no matter what they are doing - or pretend they do. Rarely do you see a cat discomfited. They have no conscience  and they never regret. Maybe we secretly envy them.
data.author: Barbara Webster

data.quote: I think I could turn and live with animals  they are so placid and self-contain'd  I stand and look at them long and long  They do not sweat and whine about their condition  They do not lie awake in the dark and weep for their sins  They do not make me sick discussing their duty to God  Not one is dissatisfied  not one is demented with the mania of owning things. Not one kneels to another  nor to his kind that liveth thousands of years ago  Not one is respectable or unhappy over the whole earth.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: The dog is the god of frolic.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Animals are such agreeable friends  they ask no questions  pass no criticisms.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: If't were not for my cat and dog  I think I could not live.
data.author: Ebenezer Elliott

data.quote: A mule has neither pride of ancestry nor hope of posterity.
data.author: Charles J. Ingersoll

data.quote: Men show their superiority inside  animals  outside.

data.quote: If you are afraid for your future  you don't have a present.

data.quote: Do not think of all your anxieties  you will only make yourself ill.

data.quote: Only man clogs his happiness with care  destroying what is with thoughts of what may be.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow  for I have seen yesterday and I love today.

data.quote: We are more disturbed by a calamity which threatens us than by one which has befallen us.

data.quote: We need not be afraid of the future  for the future will be in our own hands.

data.quote: It is never safe to look into the future with eyes of fear.

data.quote: The future is called "perhaps " which is the only possible thing to call the future. And the important thing is not to allow that to scare you.

data.quote: He who fears being conquered is sure of defeat.

data.quote: I was nervous and confident at the same time  nervous about going out there in front of all of those people  with so much at stake  and confident that I was going to go out there and win.

data.quote: There are those who are so scrupulously afraid of doing wrong that they seldom venture to do anything.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin  but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.

data.quote: To be ambitious for wealth  and yet always expecting to be poor  to be always doubting your ability to get what you long for  is like trying to reach east by traveling west. ... No matter how hard you work for success  if your thought is saturated with the fear of failure  it will kill your efforts  neutralize your endeavors and make success impossible.

data.quote: Nothing puzzles me more than time and space  yet nothing troubles me less.

data.quote: Uncertainty and expectation are the joys of life. Security is an insipid thing  and the overtaking and possessing of a wish  discovers the folly of the chase.

data.quote: If I had a formula for bypassing trouble  I wouldn't pass it around. Wouldn't be doing anybody a favour. Trouble creates a capacity to handle it. I don't say embrace trouble. data.quote: Trouble is the common denominator of living. It is the great equalizer.

data.quote: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.

data.quote: Anxiety is fear of one's self.

data.quote: Worries go down better with soup than without.

data.quote: Neurotic means he is not as sensible as I am  and psychotic means he's even worse than my brother-in-law.

data.quote: Anxiety is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged  it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained.

data.quote: For what human ill does not dawn seem to be an alleviation.

data.quote: Apology is only egotism wrong side out.

data.quote: O wad some power the giftie gie us To see oursel's as ithers see us!

data.quote: All that glisters is not gold.

data.quote: Polished brass will pass upon more people than rough gold.

data.quote: Handsome is that handsome does.
data.author: Henry Fielding

data.quote: Things are seldom what they seem  Skim milk masquerades as cream.

data.quote: Men in general judge more from appearances than from reality. All men have eyes  but few have the gift of penetration.

data.quote: Whited sepulchres  which indeed appear beautiful outward  but are within full of dead men's bones.

data.quote: She looks as if butter wouldn't melt in her mouth.

data.quote: Animals feed  man eats  die man of intellect alone knows how to eat.
data.author: Anthelme Brillat Savarin

data.quote: All philosophy in two words  - sustain and abstain.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: If you are surprised at the number of our maladies  count our cooks.

data.quote: When someone does something well  applaud I You will make two people happy.

data.quote: He who praises another enriches himself far more than he does the one praised. To praise is an investment in happiness. The poorest human being has something to give that the richest could not buy.

data.quote: The way to develop the best that is in a man is by appreciation and encouragement.

data.quote: The applause of a single human being is of great consequence.

data.quote: Most people like praise . . . When it is really deserved  most people expand under it into richer and better selves.
data.author: Joseph Farrell

data.quote: The sweetest of all sounds is praise.

data.quote: Down deep we really know our worth  but we don't have easy access to that knowledge. We need to hear praise coming from outside ourselves or we won't remember that we deserve it.
data.author: Barbara Sher

data.quote: Find the good - and praise it.

data.quote: Every day  tell at least one person something you like  admire  or appreciate about them.
data.author: Richard Carlson

data.quote: Judicious praise is to children what the sun is to flowers. Christian Bovee A little praise Goes a great ways.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Art is much less important than life  but what a poor life without it.
data.author: Robert Motherwell

data.quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: Without art  the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Art is a staple  like bread or wine or a warm coat in winter. Man's spirit grows hungry for art in the same way his stomach growls for food.

data.quote: The object of art is to give life a shape.

data.quote: The artist has a special task and duty  the task of reminding men of their humanity and the promise of their creativity.

data.quote: Each of us is an artist  capable of conceiving and creating a vision from the depths of our being.

data.quote: All that is good in art is the expression of one soul talking to another  and is precious according to the greatness of the soul that utters it.

data.quote: The artist alone sees spirits. But after he has told of their appearing to him  everybody sees them.

data.quote: Artists are nearest God. Into their souls he breathes his life  and from their hands it comes in fair  articulate forms to bless the world.
data.author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

data.quote: A work of art has an author and yet  when it is perfect  it has something which is anonymous about it.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: The true work of art is but a shadow of the divine perfection.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: The artist is the confidant of nature  flowers carry on dialogues with him through the graceful bending of their stems and the harmoniously tinted nuances of their blossoms. Every flower has a cordial word which nature directs towards him.

data.quote: There are painters who transform the sun to a yellow spot  but there are others who with the help of their art and their intelligence  transform a yellow spot into sun.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: Science and art have that in common that everyday things seem to them new and attractive.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Art arises when the secret vision of the artist and the manifestation of nature agree to find new shapes.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: Learning to draw is really a matter of learning to see - to see correctly - and that means a good deal more than merely looking with the eye.
data.author: Kimon Nicolaides

data.quote: Drawing is the discipline by which I constantly rediscover the world. I have learned that what I have not drawn  I have never really seen  and that when I start drawing an ordinary thing  I realize how extraordinary it is  sheer miracle.
data.author: Frederick Franck

data.quote: I shut my eyes in order to see.
data.author: Paul Gauguin

data.quote: Dancing is the loftiest  the most moving  the most beautiful of the arts  because it is no mere translation or abstraction from life  it is life itself.
data.author: Havelock Ellis

data.quote: The body says what words cannot.
data.author: Martha Graham

data.quote: Dancing is the body made poetic.
data.author: Ernst Bacon

data.quote: The trouble with nude dancing is that not everything stops when the music stops.
data.author: Sir Robert Helpmann

data.quote: Let that day be lost to us on which we did not dance once I
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: If you can walk  you can dance. Zimbabwe saying Music is well said to be the speech of angels.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Music is the child of prayer  the companion of religion.
data.author: Chateaubriand

data.quote: Music is the art of the prophets  the only art that can calm the agitations of the soul  it is one of the most magnificent and delightful presents God has given us.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: Musical training is a more potent instrument than any other  because rhythm and harmony find their way into the inward places of the soul.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: We are full of rhythms . . . our pulse  our gestures  our digestive tracts  the lunar and seasonal cycles.
data.author: Yehudi Menuhin

data.quote: When I hear music  I fear no danger. I am invulnerable. I see no foe. I am related to the earliest times  and to the latest.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: The best  most beautiful  and most perfect way that we have of expressing a sweet concord of mind to each other is by music.
data.author: Jonathan Edwards

data.quote: When words leave off  music begins.
data.author: Heinrich Heine

data.quote: After silence that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: Music is the universal language of mankind.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: There is no feeling  except the extremes of fear and grief that does not find relief in music.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Without music  life is a journey through a desert.
data.author: Pat Conroy

data.quote: I merely took the energy it takes to pout and wrote some blues.
data.author: Duke Ellington

data.quote: God respects me when I work  but loves me when I sing.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: We all have music inside us  and can learn how to get it out  one way or another.
data.author: Frank Wilson

data.quote: Poetry ennobles the heart and the eyes  and unveils the meaning of all things upon which the heart and the eyes dwell. It discovers the secret rays of the universe  and restores to us forgotten paradises.
data.author: Edith Sitwell

data.quote: To read a poem in January is as lovely as to go for a walk in June.
data.author: Jean Paul

data.quote: Poetry is something to make us wiser and better  by continually revealing those types of beauty and truth  which God has set in all men's souls.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: The poem is a little myth of man's capacity of making his life meaningful. And in the end  the poem is not a thing we see - it is  rather  a light by which we may see - and what we see is life.
data.author: Robert Penn Warren

data.quote: Poetry is the utterance of deep and heartfelt truth. The true poet is very near the oracle.
data.author: Edward Hubbell Chapin

data.quote: The poets are only the interpreters of the gods.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: Poetry is simply the most beautiful  impressive  and widely effective mode of saying things.
data.author: Matthew Arnold

data.quote: When power narrows the area of man's concern  poetry reminds him of the richness and diversity of his existence.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: When you read and understand a poem  comprehending its rich and formal meanings  then you master chaos a little.
data.author: Stephen Spender

data.quote: There is as much dignity in tilling a field as in writing a poem.
data.author: Booker T. Washington

data.quote: You will find poetry nowhere unless you bring some of it with you.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: The echo of a platitude.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Applause is the spur of noble minds  the end and aim of weak ones.
data.author: Walter Colton

data.quote: About the only person we ever heard of that wasn't spoiled by being lionized was a Jew named Daniel.
data.author: G. D. Prentice

data.quote: Architecture is a continuing dialogue between generations which creates an environment across time.
data.author: Vincent Scully

data.quote: Why can't we have those curves and arches that express feeling in design? What is wrong with them? Why has everything got to be vertical  straight  unbending  only at right angles - and functional?
data.author: Charles, Prince of Wales

data.quote: You have to give this much to the Luftwaffe - when it knocked down our buildings it did not replace them with anything more offensive than rubble. We did that.
data.author: Charles, Prince of Wales

data.quote: To be an architect is to possess an individual voice speaking a generally understood language of form.
data.author: Robert A. M. Stern

data.quote: In architecture the pride of man  his triumph over gravitation  his will to power  assume a visible form. Architecture is a sort of oratory of power by means of forms.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: The materials of city planning are sky  space  trees  steel and cement in that order and in that hierarchy.
data.author: Le Corbusier

data.quote: Buildings should be good neighbours.
data.author: Paul Thiry

data.quote: Pictures deface walls oftener than they decorate them.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: Life is rich  always changing  always challenging  and we architects have the task of transmitting into wood  concrete  glass and steel  of transforming human aspirations into habitable and meaningful space.
data.author: Arthur Erickson

data.quote: A building is a string of events belonging together.
data.author: Chris Fawcett

data.quote: Good architecture is like a piece of beautifully composed music crystallized in space that elevates our spirits beyond the limitation of time.
data.author: Tao Ho

data.quote: Architecture (is) a theatre stage setting where the leading actors are the people  and to dramatically direct the dialogue between these people and space is the technique of designing.
data.author: Kisho Kurokawa

data.quote: I saw the bathroom fixtures as a kind of American Trinity.
data.author: Claes Oldenberg

data.quote: Perspective is worth 80 I.Q. points.
data.author: Alan Kay

data.quote: Architecture is the will of an epoch translated into space.
data.author: Mies van der Rohe

data.quote: When you look on one of your contemporary 'good copies' of historical remains  ask yourself the question: Not what style  but in what civilization is this building? And the absurdity  vulgarity  anachronism and solecism of the modern structure will be revealed to you in a most startling fashion.
data.author: Louis H. Sullivan

data.quote: Light  God's eldest daughter  is a principal beauty in a building.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: No architecture can be truly noble which is not imperfect.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Architecture is inhabited sculpture.
data.author: Constantin Brancusi

data.quote: The flowering of geometry.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Society needs a good image of itself. That is the job of the architect.
data.author: Walter Gropius

data.quote: Architecture begins when you place two bricks carefully together.
data.author: Mies van der Rohe

data.quote: An arch never sleeps.
data.author: Hindu proverb

data.quote: Develop an infallible technique and then place yourself at the mercy of inspiration.
data.author: Ralph Rapson

data.quote: The reality of the building does not consist in the roof and walls  but in the space within to be lived in.
data.author: Lao-Tzu

data.quote: Good architecture lets nature in.
data.author: Mario Pei

data.quote: Architecture should be dedicated to keeping the outside out and the inside in.
data.author: Leonard Baskin

data.quote: Early in life I had to choose between arrogance and hypocritical humility. I chose honest arrogance and have seen no occasion to change.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: No house should ever be on a hill  or on anything. It should be of the hill. Hill and house should live together  each the happier for the other.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: How can we expect our students to become bold and fearless in thought and action if we encase them in sentimental shrines feigning a culture which has long since disappeared?
data.author: Walter Gropius

data.quote: The house does not frame the view: it projects the beholder into it.
data.author: Harwell Hamilton Harris

data.quote: Architecture is space structured to serve man and to move him.
data.author: Etienne Gaboury

data.quote: Take nothing for granted as beautiful or ugly  but take every building to pieces  and challenge every feature. Learn to distinguish the curious from the beautiful. Get the habit of analysis - analysis will in time enable synthesis to become your habit of mind. 'Think simples' as my old master used to say - meaning to reduce the whole of its parts into the simplest terms  getting back to first principles.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: Always design a thing by considering it in its next larger context - a chair in a room  a room in a house  a house in an environment  an environment in a city plan.
data.author: Eero Saarinen

data.quote: In speculative buildings  which is most of our business  there are really only three chances to make architecture: the lobby or entrance sequence  the top and the elevator cab.
data.author: Chao-Ming Wu

data.quote: A house is a machine for living.
data.author: Buckminster Fuller

data.quote: A doctor can bury his mistakes  but an architect can only advise his clients to plant vines.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: The White House was designed by Hoban  a noted Irish-American architect  and I have no doubt that he believed by incorporating several features of the Dublin style he would make it more homelike for any President of Irish descent. It was a long wait  but I appreciate his efforts.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Genius is personal  decided by fate  but it expresses itself by means of system. There is no work of art without system.
data.author: Le Corbusier

data.quote: We shape our buildings  thereafter they shape us.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: I call architecture 'petrified music'.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Form ever follows function.
data.author: Louis H. Sullivan

data.quote: Old houses mended  Cost little less than new before they're ended.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Architecture is frozen music.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Ah  to build  to build! That is the noblest of all the arts.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Arguments out of a petty mouth are unanswerable.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: Many can argue  not many converse.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott

data.quote: Wise men argue causes  and fools decide them.
data.author: Anacharsis

data.quote: When Bishop Berkeley said  "there was no matter " And proved it - 'twas no matter what he said.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Neither irony nor sarcasm is argument.
data.author: Rufus Choate

data.quote: I am bound to furnish my antagonists with arguments  but not with comprehension.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Strong and bitter words indicate a weak cause.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Insolence is not logic  epithets are the arguments of malice.
data.author: Charles J. Ingersoll

data.quote: Myself when young did eagerly frequent Doctor and Saint  and heard great argument About it and about: but evermore Came out by the same door where in I went.
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: Never argue at the dinner table  for the one who is not hungry always gets the best of the argument.
data.author: Richard Whately

data.quote: When people agree with me I always feel that I must be wrong.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: A man never tells you anything until you contradict him.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: In a true tragedy  both parties must be right.

data.quote: Some guy hit my fender the other day  and I said unto him  "Be fruitful  and multiply." But not in those words.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: We're eyeball to eyeball  and the other fellow just blinked.
data.author: Dean Rusk

data.quote: Weakness on both sides is  as we know  the motto of all quarrels.

data.quote: There is no good arguing with the inevitable. The only argument available with an east wind is to put on your overcoat.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: It is not necessary to understand things in order to argue about them.
data.author: Pierre Beaumarchais

data.quote: I learned long ago never to wrestle with a pig. You get dirty  and besides  the pig likes it.
data.author: Cyrus Ching

data.quote: The test of a man or woman's breeding is how they behave in a quarrel.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: I have never in my life learned anything from any man who agreed with me.
data.author: Dudley Field Malone

data.quote: Better be quarrelling than lonesome.
data.author: Irish proverb

data.quote: Quarrels would not last long if the fault was only on one side.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: When we quarrel  how we wish we had been blameless.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The most savage controversies are those about matters as to which there is no good evidence either way.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Every story has three sides to it - yours  mine and the facts.
data.author: Foster Meharny Russell

data.quote: (Ars longa  vita brevis.) Art is long  life is short. A picture can become for us a highway between a particular thing and a universal feeling.
data.author: Lawren Harris

data.quote: A work of art cannot be satisfied with being a representation  it should be a presentation.
data.author: Jacques Reverdy

data.quote: An amateur is an artist who supports himself with outside jobs which enable him to paint. A professional is someone whose wife works to enable him to paint.
data.author: Ben Shahn

data.quote: Art distills sensation and embodies it with enhanced meaning in memorable form - or else it is not art.
data.author: Jacques Barzun

data.quote: Artistic temperament is a disease that afflicts amateurs.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: Artists are the antennae of the race  but the bullet-headed many will never learn to trust the great artists.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: Artists must be sacrificed to their art. Like bees  they must put their lives into the sting they give.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Artists  by definition innocent  don't steal. But they do borrow without giving back.
data.author: Ned Rorem

data.quote: As a painter I shall never signify anything of importance. I feel it absolutely.
data.author: Vincent van Gogh

data.quote: Classic means standard as opposed to Romantic: form before meaning as opposed to meaning before form. It grows from inside out  while Romantic grows from outside in.
data.author: Ned Rorem

data.quote: Everything in nature is formed upon the sphere  the cone and the cylinder. One must learn to paint these simple figures and then one can do all that he may wish.
data.author: Paul Cezanne

data.quote: Fine art is that in which the hand  the head  and the heart of man go together.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Good artists exist simply in what they make  and consequently are perfectly uninteresting in what they are.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: I think there is no work of art which represents the spirit of a nation more surely than "Die Meister Singer" of Richard Wagner. Here is no plaything with local colour  but the raising to its highest power all that is best in the national consciousness of his country.
data.author: Ralph Vaughan Williams

data.quote: I wonder whether Art has a higher function than to make me feel  appreciate  and enjoy natural objects for their art value?
data.author: Bernard Berenson

data.quote: I've been 40 years discovering that the Queen of all colours is black.
data.author: Auguste Renoir

data.quote: If artists and poets are unhappy  it is after all because happiness does not interest them.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: Interpretation is the revenge of the intellect upon art.
data.author: Susan Sontag

data.quote: One of the most difficult things to do is to paint darkness which nonetheless has light in it.
data.author: Vincent van Gogh

data.quote: Painting is a faith  and it imposes the duty to disregard public opinion.
data.author: Vincent van Gogh

data.quote: Painting is silent poetry  and poetry is painting with the gift of speech
data.author: Simonides

data.quote: Rembrandt painted about 700 pictures - of these  3 000 are in existence.
data.author: Wilhelm Bode

data.quote: Still  there is a calm  pure harmony  and music inside of me.
data.author: Vincent van Gogh

data.quote: Style  like the human body  is specially beautiful when the veins are not prominent and the bones cannot be counted.
data.author: Tacitus

data.quote: The fingers must be educated  the thumb is born knowing.
data.author: Marc Chagall

data.quote: The genuine artist is as much a dissatisfied person as the revolutionary  yet how diametrically opposed are the products each distills from his dissatisfaction.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: The object of art is to give life a shape.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: The scholar seeks  the artist finds.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: The song of the brush.
data.author: Chinese saying

data.quote: Theatre takes place all the time wherever one is and art simply facilitates persuading one this is the case.
data.author: John Cage

data.quote: Two boys arrived yesterday with a pebble they said was the head of a dog until I pointed out that it was really a typewriter.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: We live in a rainbow of chaos.
data.author: Paul Cezanne

data.quote: We must grant the artist his subject  his idea  his donnee: Our criticisms apply only to what he makes of it.
data.author: Henry James

data.quote: When they asked Michelangelo how he made his statue of David he is reported to have said  "It is easy. You just chip away the stone that doesn't look like David."
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: Works of Art are of an infinite loneliness.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: Art is I  science is we.
data.author: Claude Bernard

data.quote: The artist  like the God of the creation  remains within or behind or beyond or above his handiwork  invisible  refined  out of existence  indifferent  paring his fingernails.
data.author: James Joyce

data.quote: Designers and free lance artists and editors can set their hourly rates by dividing their annual income needs by 1000.
data.author: Mike Rider

data.quote: Children  like animals  use all their senses to discover the world. Then artists come along and discover it the same way all over again.
data.author: Eudora Welty

data.quote: When power leads man toward arrogance  poetry reminds him of his limitations. When power narrows the areas of man's concern  poetry reminds him of the richness and diversity of his experience. When power corrupts  poetry cleanses. For art establishes the basic human truths which must serve as the touchstones of our judgement. The artist. . . faithful to his personal vision of reality  becomes the last champion of the individual mind and sensibility against an intrusive society and an offensive state.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Art is the expression of an enormous preference.
data.author: Wyndham Lewis

data.quote: Conception  my boy  fundamental brainwork  is what makes the difference in all art.
data.author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti

data.quote: An artist may visit a museum but only a pedant can live there.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: All profoundly original art looks ugly at first.
data.author: Clement Greenberg

data.quote: Pioneers did not produce original works of art  because they were creating original human environments  they did not imagine Utopias because they were shaping them.
data.author: George Woodcock

data.quote: Art is a human activity  consisting in this  that one man consciously  by means of external signs  hands on to others feelings he has worked through  and other people are infected by these feelings and also experience them.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy
